articles.title: About this site
articles.description: Some additional details about the website

articles.title: Data manipulation and visualization
articles.description: Resources to learn and improve data manipulation, exploration and visualization in R.
articles.contents:
Contents
Data Science
Data Manipulation
Data Visualization
Shiny


Data Science
Global resources to start data science including introductory and intermediate material on data manipulation, exploration, visualization and analysis.
Name
Links
STAT 545 J Bryan – A course about data wrangling, exploration, and analysis with R

R for Data Science H Wickham, G Grolemund Introduction to data science: import, transform, visualize and model data with literate programming and reproducible research
 
ModernDive C Ismay, A Y Kim – A textbook about statistical Inference via Data Science

Introduction to Data Science R A Irizarry – A textbook from R basics to an introduction to machine learning, through data manipulation and statistics in R

R Programming 101 – A youtube channel about data cleaning, manipulation & visualization

Exploratory Data Analysis J Helveston – A course to learn how to import, manipulate, clean, explore, visualize, and export data in R

Data Manipulation
Name
Links
Data Wrangling with R and the Tidyverse G. Grolemund An introductory playlist

Cleaning ecological survey data for conservation scientists C J Brown, C Buelow –

dplyr R Programming - DDS – an introductory playlist to dplyr and its functions

Data Visualization
Name
Links
Fundamentals of Data Visualization C . Wilke Theory on how to make right and nice figures, not R focused

R Graphics Cookbook W. Chang – A practical guide to help you generate high-quality graphs

R for Ecologists a youtube channel including basics on R and visualization

ggplot2 H. Wickham focus on explaining the grammar of graphics that ggplot2 uses, it is not a cookbook

Visualization – a R studio youtube playlist

Shiny
Name
Links
Shiny gallery – Find ideas about what is possible to do

A shiny workshop to start D Valle and others – A full course to start with shiny

Mastering Shiny Hadley Wickham – Designed to take you from knowing nothing about Shiny to being an expert developer

Engineering Production-Grade Shiny Apps C Fay, S Rochette, V Guyader, C Girard – learn the process of building an application that will later be sent to production

Shiny Developer Series – a youtube channel

articles.title: Ethical Statistics
articles.description: Resources for reproducible and ethical Statistics.
articles.contents:
Contents
Reproducibility
Tidyverse
Rmarkdown
Git

Ethics
Open science

Reproducibility
Name
Links
Reproducible science workshop O Gimenez – A full overview to start making your analyses reproducible

Tidyverse
Name
Links
Tidy Modeling with R M Kuhn, J Silge – Introduction to how to use Tidyverse

Rmarkdown
Name
Links
R Markdown: The Definitive Guide Y Xie, J J Allaire, G Grolemund – A complete and introducing reference book to use R Markdown

R Markdown Cookbook Y Xie, C Dervieux, E Riederer – A practical reference book for R Markdown

Tables generator – Create a markdown table

Git
Name
Links
Happy Git and GitHub for the useR – Learn how to start and integrate git into your daily work with R and Markdown

Github Docs – Official documentation

Ethics
Name
Links


Open science
Name
Links
SORTEE Society for Open, Reliable, and Transparent Ecology and Evolutionary biology

articles.title: Mathematics
articles.description: Resources on mathematical concepts useful for ecological statistics
articles.contents:
Contents
Calculus
Probability
Algebra
Teaching Mathematics in Ecology

Calculus
Name
Links
Learning Centennial College M Cheung – Definitions of useful words

Derivatives of Common Functions – Cheatsheet

Probability
Name
Links
Probability S Jadhav – Probability theory & description of main distributions, not really ecologist friendly…

Algebra
Name
Links
Learning Centennial College M Cheung – Definitions of useful words in Linear Algebra

Teaching Mathematics in Ecology
Name
Links
What math should ecologists teach? B McGill

Lack of quantitative training among early-career ecologists: a survey of the problem and potential solutions F Barraquand et al.

Writing mathematical ecology: A guide for authors and readers L G Shoemaker et al

Mathematical Ecology: A Century of Progress, and Challenges for the Next Century S Levin Lecture in 2017

articles.title: R
articles.description: Resources to start programming and statistics with R
articles.contents:
Contents
Programming in R
Data science in R
Packages
Others

Programming in R
Name
Links
First steps in R Institut Pasteur & USR 3756 – A very bascis tutorial to start R

Hands-On Programming with R G Grolemund – A practical guide to start programming with R

Introduction to Programming with R R Stauffer et al. – Basics R, writing, coding & manipulating data

Intro to Programming for Analytics J Helveston – Basics in R, include an introduction to Python

R introduction J Mathys VIB – A simple tutorial to start with R, only

How to R – A youtube channel incuding short videos on basics R, data manipulation and visualization

Advanced R H Wickham –

Efficient R programming C Gillespie R Lovelace – Increase the amount of work you can do with R in a given amount of time

Avoid for loops R programming DDS – Learn how to make your code faster

Data science in R
Name
Links
Statistics and Data Science with R M Marin – A complete course to start statistics with R. 5 series: getting started, descriptive statistics, probability distribution, bivariate analysis, linear regression with R

Introduction to data science R A Irizarry – A complete guide including R basics, data wrangling, data visualisation, statistics and machine learning

R Programming for Data Science R D Peng – Start with R, load and manipulate your data

Learning statistics with R D Navarro – A tutorial for beginners to start statistics and simple tests with R

Applied Quantitative Methods D McGlinn – A more advanced course introducing R programming, version control, SQL, GIS, spatial statistics, multivariate statistics

Packages
Name
Links
R Packages H Wickham, J Bryan

Others
Name
Links
R studio cheatsheets – Very useful synthetic sheets to find the function you need

Rstudio youtube channel

R Reference Card – Quick access & definition to simple R functions

R-Uni – A list of R tutorials and resources in university webpages

articles.title: Statistics
articles.description: Resources for a general introduction to descriptive and inferentials Statistics
articles.contents:
Contents
Overview
Distributions

Overview
Name
Links
Statistics 101 B Foltz – Complete videos for an introduction to statistics including descriptive statistics, Hypothesis testing, distributions, regression

MarinStatsLectures M Marin – A full course with 3 series: descriptive statistics, univariate analysis, bivariate analysis

Statistical Inference for biology McClatchy, Churchill – a course about inferential statistics

Statistics Simple Learning pro – Basics videos to start statistics

Zedstatistics Zedstatistics – a youtube channel including simple playlists about Descriptive statistics, Distribution, Inferential statistics, Regression

Learning Centennial College M Cheung – Definitions of useful words in statistics

Biology for life G von Bargen – Descriptions of simple statistical concepts and tests used in biology

STAT506 Penn State College Penn State College – a full course about Sampling design

Distributions
Name
Links
The distribution zoo B Lambert, F Cooper – A ShinyApp to visualize distributions

articles.title: Community Analysis
articles.contents:
Contents
Overview
Hierarchical Model
Vegan

Overview
Name
Links
Analysis of community ecology data in R D Zelený – A wiki giving an introductory overview of relevant theory, real community datasets and example R scripts

Numerical Ecology P Legendre, L Legendre – Reference textbook

Numerical Ecology with R D Borcard, F Gillet, P Legendre– Exploration of the methods by means of applied and extensively commented examples

Hierarchical Model
Vegan
A R package for community analysis
Name
Links
Introduction to multivariate data analysis using vegan G Simpson – a practical introduction to some of the most useful functions in vegan

Multivariate Analysis of Ecological Communities in R: vegan tutorial J. Oksanen – demostrates the use of ordination methods in Rpackage vegan, assumes familiarity both with R andwith community ordination

A Vegan Tutorial P Clark – Quick introduction to useful functions

Advanced community data analysis using the vegan package in R G Simpson N Zimmerman – a follow-up to the “Introduction to vegan” session teaching when and how to use multivariate methods including constrained ordinatio as well as between-group tests

Vegan cheat sheet A Bui

articles.title: Learn EcoStat
articles.description: A useful list of Resources to teach and learn Ecological Statistics
articles.contents:
Contents
People to be contacted at first:
Basics
R
Ethics
Data
Stats
Maths

Modeling
Regression
Bayesian Approach
Multivariate Analyses
Machine Learning

byField
Demography
Population Dynamics
Spatial Analyses

Cross-species Analysis
Quantitative Genetics
Network Analysis


full course  video  exo  open book, tutorial, manual 
book (not free)  article website
level: begin  intermediate  advanced 
People to be contacted at first:
people that we know and that might be interested to be in charge of some parts: S Cubaynes, M Gamelon, V Miele, Y vindenes, A Lee, C Nater, P de Villemeureuil, AB Dufour, F Husson
Basics
R
be in charge: V Miele?
contribute: I think there is already enough online
Programming in R
Data science in R
Packages
Ethics
be in charge: Sandra?
contribute: V Amrhein, A Gelman, S Nakagawa (Founding Members of Sortee),

Ethics
Open science

be in charge: Olivier?
contribute: already a lot of things to add from the net
Data Science

contribute: already some stuff online

Distributions
Maths
be in charge: Fred?
contribute: Mathiopoulos, B McGill, S Otto, F Débarre, Lyon teachers?, M bonsall
There are things online but I did not find really ecologist friendly courses so far. Need more time to have a look.
Calculus
Probability
Algebra
Teaching Mathematics in Ecology
Modeling
Regression
be in charge:

contribute: RA Poldrack, Mickael Clark, William A Link, Peter Adler

articles.title: Bayesian Approach
articles.contents:
Contents
Overview
Priors
MCMC
Convergence & Identifiability
Packages & software
JAGS
Stan
Nimble


Overview
Name
Links
Bayesian statistics with R O. Gimenez – A clear introduction to Bayesian Analysis using R and jags, including practical

Statistical Rethinking R McElreath – A complete course about Bayesian inference and regression, including covariance structure, using stan
 
Bayesian Modeling for Socio-Environmental Data T Hobbs, M Collins, C Che-Castaldo – A course with r and jags providing an understanding to Bayesian methods, statistical concepts and methodology

Bayesian statistics course F. Barraquand – A full Master course to learn Baysian statistics including MCMC, Anova, GLMM, non-linear models, occupancy models and model selection

BiogecoBayes – A collection of useful Workshops created by a group of researchers & students who want to progress together in their learning

Bayesian Models: A Statistical Primer for Ecologists T Hobbs, M Hooten – Presents the mathematical and statistical foundations of Bayesian modeling in language accessible to non-statisticians

Learning Bayesian Statistics – a podcast channel presenting scientists, their approach and thinking in Bayesian statistics

Priors
Name
Links
MCMC
Name
Links
The Markov-chain Monte Carlo Interactive Gallery – view algorithms

Convergence & Identifiability
Name
Links
Packages & software
JAGS
Stan
Name
Links
Become a Bayesian with R & Stan M Clark – a basic introduction to the probabilistic programming language Stan

Stan for Ecology – location for all types of work in ecology that use the software Stan for Bayesian inference

Stan User Guide Stan Development Team –

Nimble
Name
Links
nimble-training C Paciorek, D Turek, P de Valpine – several workshops to learn programming with nimble

nimble manual NIMBLE Development Team – official & useful manual

nimble cheatsheet

nimble NIMBLE Development Team – nimble website, download, find examples and documentation

articles.title: Machine Learning
articles.contents:
Name
Links
A practical guide to machine learning in ecology J Lefcheck – blog introducing machine learning to ecologists

Deep Learning for Ecology P Gray – a brief overview of the applications of deep learning to ecology and remote sensing

Data Science Live Book P Casas – a book about data preparation, data analysis and machine learning

Machine Learning for Ecology and Sustainable Natural Resource Management G Humphries, D R Magness, F Huettmann – Shows ecologists cutting-edge methods that can help in understanding complex systems with multiple interacting variables to form predictive hypotheses from large datasets, including practical examples

Machine Learning Mastery – A site including tutorials for machine learning from beginners to advanced levels

In-depth introduction to machine learning T Hastie and R Tibshirani – 2014, A full introduction to start Machine Learning

Oxford Machine Learning N de Freitas, B Shillingford, M Moczulsky a Maths course to introduce numerical computation, statistics and optimization to be able to design and implement machine learning algorithms, prerequisites in maths and programming

A translucent box: interpretable machine learning in ecology T C D Lucas

Applications for deep learning in ecology S Christin, E Hervet, N Lecomte –

Deep learning as a tool for ecology and evolution Borowiec et al.

Machine learning to classify animal species in camera trap images: Applications in ecology Tabac et al.

Awesome Machine Learning – A list of machine learning frameworks, libraries and software

Have a look also to wikistat (Insa Toulouse, but in french)

articles.title: Multivariate Analysis
articles.description: Resources to learn and develop multivariate analyses
articles.contents:
Contents
Overview
Ordination Methods
Clustering

Overview
Name
Links
Multivariate Analysis S. Jadhav A list of videos introducing r, multivariate analysis, PCA and clustering

Exploratory Multivariate Data Analysis F Husson, J Pagès, M Houée-Bigot – a MOOC including PCA, CA, MCA and clustering

Gusta Me – a website describing range of analysis techniques used in microbial ecology including data preparation, ordination and clustering methods

Applied Multivariate Statistical Analysis Penn State College – a full course examining a variety of statistical methods for multivariate data, including multivariate extensions of t-tests and analysis of variance, dimension reduction techniques such as principal component analysis, factor analysis, canonical correlation analysis, and classification and clustering methods.

Multivariate Analysis S Dray – Slides from a Master course including PCA, Correspondance Analysis & two-table analysis

Ordination Methods
Name
Links
Ordination Methods for Ecologists M. Palmer – A full presentation of theory and main ordination methods

related links: http://ordination.okstate.edu/otherlinks.html
Clustering

articles.title: Regression
articles.description: Resources for modeling: from linear models to non linear models .
articles.contents:
Contents
Overview
Linear models LM, GLM
Mixed models LMM, GLMM
GAMM
Structural Equation Modeling
Plot your model
Check your model
Model Selection
Model Averaging

Overview
Name
Links
Statistics for ecologists O. Gimenez – A master course introducing likelihoods, hypothesis testing, Bayesian inference, GLM, GLMM, GAM

Statistical Thinking for the 21st Century R A Poldrack – focuses on understanding the basic ideas of statistical thinking, about how we describe the world and use data make decisions and predictions, in the context of the inherent uncertainty that exists in the real world

Michael Clark site – A series of open introductory workshop in bayesian analysis, mixed models, GAM, SEM and machine learning

Beyond Multiple Linear Regression P Roback, J Legler – A full textbook to apply Generalized Linear Models and Multilevel Models in R

Linear models LM, GLM
Name
Links
Regression Methods I Pardoe from Penn State College – a full course on Linear regression, also introducing Generalized linear regression

Mixed models LMM, GLMM
Name
Links
GLMM course S. Anderson– a 2 day workshop including a full introduction: regression, random intercepts and slopes, spatial and temporal autocorrelation, including practical

GLMM FAQ B.Bolker et al.

Rpubs B. Bolker – “blog form”, A collection of short tuto on specific subjects

Generalized linear mixed models: a practical guide for ecology and evolution B.Bolker et al.

How to Make Models Add Up — A Primer on GLMMs R O’Hara

SIMR: an R package for power analysis of generalized linear mixed models by simulation P Greenet al. – 2016

Beyond Power Calculations: Assessing Type S (Sign) and Type M (Magnitude) Errors A Gelman, J Carlin – 2014

Introduction to mixed models H Brown – March 2016. Series of videos giving a general but quick & unfriendly introduction

GLMM for ecologists and evolutionary biologists*  B.Bolker et al. a wiki including resources on the practical use of GLMM

GAMM
Name
Links
Introduction to Generalized Additive Models with R and mgcv G Simpson a 3h course introducing how to fit and check GAM

mgcv course G Simpson, N Ross, Slides and exercices from a day workshop introducing how to fit and check GAM

Structural Equation Modeling
Name
Links
An Introduction to Structural Equation Modeling J Lefcheck – A complete book introducing SEM and the piecewiseSEM package

Structural equation modeling and natural systems JB Grace – 2006

Cause and Correlation in Biology: A User’s Guide to Path Analysis, Structural Equations and Causal Inference with R B Shipley – 2016

Plot your model
Name
Links
Check your model
Name
Links
Model Selection
Name
Links
A practical guide to selecting models for exploration, inference, and prediction in ecology Tredennick et al.

Model Averaging
Name
Links

articles.title: Links
articles.contents:
Name
Links
Cross-Validated – The statistical forum

Ourcodingclub – Many different tutorial made by a group of student and researcher from the University of Edinburgh

Ecological Applications in R – a youtube channel creating for the Covid

Conservation hackers – forum, blog and courses for conservation scientists

R4DS – a community of R learners at all skill levels working together to improve their skills

Discdown – regrouping courses such as Data Analytic, programming in R and Flexible Regressions
